body_html:
The issue with casting away the imaginary part of the gradient shouldn't affect either of you.
It only seems to affect the final result that's returned by tf.gradients, not any of the intermediate computations. If your gradients are all real (as they should be if you want to run an optimization), then you won't have any issues with this.

body:
The issue with casting away the imaginary part of the gradient shouldn't affect either of you.
It only seems to affect the final result that's returned by `tf.gradients`, not any of the intermediate computations. If your gradients are all real (as they should be if you want to run an optimization), then you won't have any issues with this.
